The heart of the game is card drafting, so a little luck is involved. Three scoring rounds will take place through the game, all player-induced. Players who have been ready for the scoring rounds, will take the lead.

[SP] Representas a un joven emprendedor interesado en invertir en un negocio en expansión: el ferrocarril. Construye estaciones, firma contratos con compañías mercantiles, compra certificados de acción, ¡y no olvides a los pasajeros! Revive la historia extendiendo tus vías entre las ciudades que vieron crecer la red ferroviaria española durante el s. XIX.

Los jugadores deben no solo decidir cuáles son las acciones más propicias durante su turno actual, sino también prever dónde les será conveniente realizarlas en su próximo turno. El corazón del juego está en el robo de cartas, así que un poco de suerte resulta favorable. A lo largo de la partida se producirá un total de tres rondas de puntuación, inducidas por los propios jugadores. Aquellos jugadores que hayan sabido anticiparse a las rondas de puntuación resultarán aventajados.

69711.name: Rippers Player's Guide
69711.description:
From the back of the book:

Everybody knows there are no such things are monsters... You know better.

To the ordinary people of Victorian society, monsters are but silly superstitions or the cheap fiction of the penny bloods sold on the streets. But you are far from ordinary. You have seen horrors fearsome enough to stop a brave man's heart, and you have lived to tell the tale.

You are a Ripper - one of a secret band of monster hunters dedicated to saving humanity - and the horrors that stalk the night are your prey. To aid in this struggle, Rippers extract the essence of these monsters' powers and use them to enchance their own abilities. But be warned, by taking such horrific measure you risk losing your mind...or worse. Torn between the need for greater power and the threat of terrifying insanity, you must choose how best to fight the creatures of the night. Choose well, for if the Rippers fail humanity is lost!

Rippers is a Plot Point setting for the Savage Worlds Roleplaying Game.


Note: This is a stripped down version of the original Rippers book. The Adventure and GM information has been removed and is meant to give to your players so they may play the game without having to purchase the full rules. Permission is given to make copies for your players when this PDF is purchased.

69712.name: Dark Cloud

videogamefranchise.6404: Greatest Hits (Best Selling PlayStation Games, US)

videogamehonor.29702: 2002 D.I.C.E. Best Role-Playing Game of the Year Nominee (Console)

69712.description:
"Dark Cloud (ダーククラウド, Dāku Kuraudo) is a role-playing video game for the PlayStation 2. It was developed by Level-5 and published by Sony Computer Entertainment in 2000 and 2001 for Japan and American/PAL regions respectively. The gameplay of Dark Cloud combines action role-playing with elements of city-building games. There is currently one sequel to the game, Dark Cloud 2, released two years later.

The game's story focuses on a group of adventurers who have all been affected by the destruction caused by the Dark Genie and have banded together to fight it. The main protagonist is Toan, a young boy for the village of Norune. He is given a magical stone called the "Atlamillia" by the Fairy King which has the power to rebuild the towns and villages that were destroyed.
"

Source: Wikipedia, "Dark_Cloud," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

69713.name: Perseus and the Sanctum of the Medusa
69713.description:
Perseus and the Sanctum of the Medusa is a non-profit, unauthorised, non-collectable card game, set within the confines of a torch-lit underground chamber holding the only mortal Gorgon, Medusa.

Consisting of two balanced 50-card decks, the game pits two players against each other in a life or death struggle. One player takes the role of the mythical hero Perseus, and his opponent assumes control of his quarry, the serpentine Medusa.

At his disposal, Perseus has four Greek soldiers to help corner and behead the, once beautiful beast, whose very expression now turns people to stone. His equipment includes treasures gifted to him by various Olympians and the Hesperides: a polished shield, adamantine sword, and a knapsack kibisis to safely contain Medusa's head.

The game has an asymmetrical design, with both decks featuring different cards and abilities. Perseus and the Sanctum of the Medusa is played without a board or map, with cards placed out by the Perseus player to simulate the Greeks' investigation of the column and statue strewn chamber. Gameplay is quick and bloodthirsty with Greeks petrified, or slain by bowshot and acid pool frequently.

Drawn partially from Greek myth, the game is inspired hugely by the 1981 film Clash of the Titans.

The game's lineage can be traced back to Magic: The Gathering, BattleTech CCG, and Iliad.

69714.name: Kingdom Hearts

videogamehonor.37529: 2001–2002 Japan Game Awards Game of the Year Winner

69714.description:
"Kingdom Hearts (キングダム ハーツ, Kingudamu Hātsu) is an action role-playing game developed and published by Square Soft (now Square Enix) in 2002 for the PlayStation 2 video game console. The first game in the Kingdom Hearts series, it is the result of a collaboration between Square Enix and The Walt Disney Company. The game combines characters and settings from Disney animated features with those from Square's Final Fantasy series. The story follows a young boy, Sora, as he is thrown into an epic battle against the forces of darkness. He is joined by Donald Duck and Goofy, classic Disney characters who help him on his quest.

Kingdom Hearts was a departure from Square's standard role-playing games, introducing a substantial action-adventure element to the gameplay. In addition, it has an all-star voice cast which includes many of the Disney characters' official voice actors. Kingdom Hearts was longtime Square character designer Tetsuya Nomura's first time in a directorial position."

Source: Wikipedia, "Kingdom_Hearts_(video_game)," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

69715.name: Kingdom Hearts II

videogamehonor.37523: 2004 Japan Game Awards Best Unreleased Game Winner

69715.description:
"Kingdom Hearts II (キングダムハーツII, Kingudamu Hātsu II) is an action role-playing game developed by Square Enix and published by Buena Vista Games and Square Enix in 2005 for the Sony PlayStation 2 video game console. The game is a sequel to the 2002 Disney Interactive and Square collaboration, Kingdom Hearts, which combined Disney and Square elements into an action role-playing game, though it is significantly darker in tone than its predecessor. The game's popularity has resulted in a novel and manga series based upon it and an international version called Kingdom Hearts II Final Mix, released in March 2007.

Kingdom Hearts II is the third game in the Kingdom Hearts series. It picks up one year after the events of Kingdom Hearts: Chain of Memories. Sora, the protagonist of the first two games, returns to search for his lost friends. Like the previous games, Kingdom Hearts II features a large cast of characters from Disney films and Final Fantasy games. Organization XIII, a group introduced in Chain of Memories, also reappears to impede Sora's progress."

Source: Wikipedia, "Kingdom_Hearts_II," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

69716.name: The Famous Dick Turpin
69716.description: From the Publisher: In this game players are highwaymen, trying to make their fortune by holding-up the 'Silver Flyer',a stagecoach making its winding way across England & into Scotland. Players ambush the coach to rob the wealthy passengers on board. But beware! The passengers may fight back. Worse, you may even meet another highwayman at your chosen hide-out - perhaps Dick Turpin himself - who has the same plan but has no intention of sharing his ill-gotten gains with anyone else!

69721.name: Scrabble Trickster
69721.description:
In this twist on the classic word game, Scrabble, players use their seven drawn letter-tiles to form words on the gameboard. The twist is that now, proper names such as cities or celebrity names will now be allowed. Other twists include "playing words backwards or playing words unconnected to others on the board," Mattel said. The game is a limited edition and will not replace the original Scrabble.

Just like regular Scrabble, each word laid out earns points based on the commonality of the letters used, with certain board spaces giving bonuses. But a word can only be played if it uses at least one already-played tile or adds to an already-played word. This leads to slightly tactical play, as potential words are rejected because they would give an opponent too much access to the better bonus spaces.

Not all precise details are known yet as Scrabble Trickster is due out in July in the U.K. only.

Source from The Detroit News: http://www.detnews.com/article/20100408/NATION/4080379/1013/...
(This is now a pay-only link.)

69722.name: Death on the Seas
69722.description:
From the rules:

"This game is designed to provide simple and easy to use rules for fighting small scale naval battles featuring around half a dozen ships per side. The rules are written with 1/600th scale ships in mind, but it would be possible to use other sized miniatures...Death on the Seas is historically set in the 5th Century BC, during the Persian Wars, but the rules feature statistics for ships from both earlier and later periods.
Several of the core mechanics for this game have their origins in the 5.56mm game and will therefore be familiar to anyone who has read those rules."

From the Wargames Journal website (blurb by the creator)

"...a fast play set of [free] rules that can be used with just about any scale of ancient ships (the target was 1/600th scale) and are based on a premise of one model equals one ship."

69723.name: Rise Alabama!
69723.description:
From the publisher's website:

"Trouble lurks on the high seas. A not-so-bon voyage becomes increasingly tense. Are the passengers going mad? Is it just coincidence? Or is there something sinister lurking somewhere in the depths? Rise Alabama features a complete 15-page adventure suitable for an evening's entertainment, two detailed multi-level ship maps, and Figure Flats for all the characters you'll encounter!"

69724.name: Bank It!
69724.description:
From publisher's website:

"Bank It!
Earn. Save. Buy a bike!

Race other players to save enough money to purchase a new bicycle! Earn money doing chores and other jobs. Earn interest on your savings account. Manage your money wisely and shop for a good bargain. "

69727.name: The Winds of Magic
69727.description:
Magic pervades the Old World, coursing through the Eight Winds. Humans that learn to harness the energy found in the Winds of Magic can become powerful wizards. Or they may succumb to Tzeentch, the Changer of Ways, tempted by his offer of power, knowledge, and mastery of the dark arts.

The Winds of Magic is a valuable resource for Warhammer Fantasy Roleplay. It provides all players with important background and setting information on the Colleges of Magic, new rules and tools for wizards to practice their art, dozens of new spells across all eight College Orders, and more suggestions and guidance for playing wizard characters.

For the GM, The Winds of Magic also introduces the Ruinous Power Tzeentch, his daemonic minions, and insights into the Great Conspirator’s fiendish schemes. New rules for corruption and mutation expose the characters to greater risks over the course of their adventures. Finally, The Winds of Magic includes a complete adventure for GMs to challenge their players with a dangerous plot unfolding in the heart of the Empire.

[From back of product]

69730.name: Dragon (Issue 271 - May 2000)
69730.description:
Diabolical Puzzles for your Campaign!

Vol. XXIV, No. 12
Cover art by Mark Zug

69731.name: Dragon (Issue 270 - Apr 2000)
69731.description:
Create High-Level Havoc with Hell on Earth!

Vol. XXIV, No. 11
Cover art by Tony DiTerlizzi

69732.name: Dragon (Issue 269 - Mar 2000)
69732.description:
Familiars & Pets!

Vol. XXIV, No. 10
Cover art by Larry Elmore

69733.name: Trail Magic:
69733.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Learn about hiking the Appalachian Trail as you play the Trail Magic game. Fun and fast moving play is created by a combination of multiple choice trivia questions, chance, food rations and questions about your trail mates. The game is designed for groups of 2 or more and ages 10 and up.

Start at either Springer Mountain in Georgia, the southern end of the trail or at Mt. Katahdin in Maine at the northern end. Pick up rations at food stops, cross your fingers that the bears don't eat your food, and answer trivia questions as you try to make your way to the other end of the trail.

The game board shows many of the important landmarks and towns along the trail as well as watercolor illustrations of a few sites. 140 trivia cards as well as 60 environmental hazard & hiking community cards are included.

A portion of proceeds from the sale of Trail Magic benefits the Appalachian Trail Conference, which maintains the Appalachian Trail.

69734.name: Dragon (Issue 260 - Jun 1999)
69734.description:
Take to the Sky & Customize your Dragon!

Vol. XXIV, No. 1
Cover art by Jeff Easley

69735.description:
WWE Slam Attax is a Trading Card Game by Topps Trading Cards. It features WWE Superstars from the Raw, Smackdown and ECW brands along with WWE Divas and WWE Legends. Each Superstar has an Attack and Defense rating out of 100, and a star rating out of 5.

2 players start with 9 randomly selected cards lying face against the ground. These cards are the main roster player. There are two additional cards on the sides of 9 major cards. Both cards are cards Tag Team. The player decides which begins on a playing card with his main roster, and decides whether he wants to attack or defend. He turned the card to reveal Superstar. The opponent must then take a card either defend or attack (depending on the choice of boot drive). The losing card is removed from the game. At any moment a player can choose to spend a card to one of two cards Tag Team. There are also Champion and finishing move cards. These contractors and finishing move cards are superior to the rest of the bridge, but can not be used for cards Championship is equipped with that specific Superstar. Whoever has the most to gain (or face) cards wins the game.
69735.name: Slam Attax

69736.name: Cosmic Dice
69736.description:
Aliens of many different races have come together, some in war, others in negotiations.

In this game you will be encountering random players and either fighting to take them over or negotiating and coexisting. The random 5 aliens selected each game will vary the game play and manipulate the game through the various powers. See if you can come out in the lead conquering or negotiating to establish 5 colonies first.

This game uses a locking die mechanic that is seen in many other express games and emphasizes push your luck mechanics. You may be forced to negotiate even when it isn't in your best interest, or you might try for a higher number only to lose the die from the X result.

69737.name: Dragon (Issue 261 - Jul 1999)

rpgissuearticle.45945: Arcane Lore - Conjuring in the Half-Dark

69737.description:
Be Afraid of the Dark!!

Vol. XXIV, No. 2
Cover art by Fred Fields

69738.name: .hack // INFECTION
69738.description:
(From the game box)

You're in their WORLD now!

Who is Aura? What is the Book of Twilight? Why did you friend, Orca, fall into a mysterious coma? As the outlaw player, Kite, you're on a mission of truth. Take a journey into a virtual world where anything is possible, and nothing is as it appears. Fight your way through contaminated levels of cyberspace as you take on and eliminate enemies, and unlock codes that will allow you to gate travel to even more environments - all in the desperate attempt to discover who or what's behind The World.

69739.name: .hack // MUTATION
69739.description:
(From the game box)

The Saga continues...

As the outlaw player, Kite, you're on a mission of truth. Take a journey into a virtual world where anything is possible, and nothing is as it appears. Fight your way through contaminated levels of cyberspace as you take on and eliminate enemies and unlock codes that will allow you to gate hack to even more environments - all in a depserate attempt to discover who or what's behind The World.

69740.name: .hack // OUTBREAK
69740.description:
(From the game box)

Which Way Now?

In the 3rd chapter of the .hack saga, "The World" continues to deteriorate as the virus spreads out of control. As the outlaw player, Kite, you must choose your strategy wisely. Not only is the OUTBREAK affecting "The World" in the game, but now repercussions are being felt in the real world too. Is there a way to stop this OUTBREAK? Where does the answer to the mystery lie? Fight through contaminated cyberspace as you take on and eliminate enemies and unlocks codes to gate hack to even more environments. Will you ever find out who or what is behind this nightmare and wake Orca from his coma?

69741.name: .hack // QUARANTINE
69741.description:
(From the game box)

The Last Stand...

In the final episode of the .hack saga, play as the outlaw player Kite to finally unravel the mystery behind "The World". And this time it's against the clock...
As events in "The World" continue to create havoc in the real world, CC Corp. faces increasing pressure to move the game servers offline, meaning certain death for all comatose victimes. It's up to you now. Can you cure this virus and restore order in "The World"? And can you do it before time runs out for your friend, Orca?

69742.name: Indigo Prophecy

videogamehonor.31771: 2005 Game Critics Most Original Game of the Year Nominee

69742.description:
(From the game box)

Guilt is a chilling feeling.

In the men's room of a diner a mysterious murder takes place. The murderer is an ordinary man. He has no idea who his victim is... But this isn't an isolated incident. All over New York regular people are killing total strangers. The only link between the killings is that they all show the same ritual patterns.

Become the four key characters to control the story in your own way. The murderer: Lucas Kane. The smouldering detective: Carla Valenti. The NYPD agnet: Tyler Miles. And the murderer's brother and priest: Markus Kane.

Discover the truth: Why did you kill him? What made you do it? And who is controlling the murderers? This is a unique chance to run from the police and hide from yourself. Welcome to a new form of video game...

69743.name: Echo Night: Beyond
69743.description:
"Echo Night: Beyond, known in Japan as Nebula: Echo Night (エコーナイト, Nebyura Ekō Naito) is an adventure video game for the PlayStation 2 console. It was released during 2004 in Japan and the United States, with the European release not following until 2006. It is the third game in the Echo Night series.

The game tells a science fiction ghost story, set in the not-too-distant future. Players take the role of a newlywed, off for a honeymoon on the moon. The vessel crashes before reaching its lunar resort destination, however, separating the just-married couple and leaving the hero alone at an abandoned research base. Players explore the station from a first-person perspective, inside a spacesuit. In addition to the many spiritual anomalies that seem to haunt the forgotten station, strange lunar lighting and relative weightlessness add to the unfamiliar creepiness of the game's environments."

Source: Wikipedia, "Echo_Night:_Beyond," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

69744.name: Első számjátékom
69744.description: A game with numbers for small children. Every player gets the same number cards (they depict every number between 1 and 10 twice), and a goal number between 1 and 20 is turned up. The first player who can make this number using his/her number cards, addition and subtraction can discard those cards. Then another goal number is turned up. The winner is the first player who discards all the cards.

69745.name: Guckloch
69745.description:
In Guckloch, the players have to recognize pictures through a little hole in a board. If they can name the object they see just partly, they can add it to her collection. The player who has collected a certain combination of pictures first is the winner.

69746.name: The Black Anhk

What happened to a missing Rippers expedition? What is the strange secret of Setmosis? What horrors lie beneath Egypt's shifting sands?

All is revealed in this new adventure for Rippers by Paul "Wiggy" Wade-Williams. Lead your team to the baking deserts of Egypt in search of an ancient mystery.

Made for use with the Rippers roleplaying setting, this 23 page pdf requires the Savage Worlds rulebook to play. Comes with a printer friendly "lite" version, too to save toner or ink.

This is a PDF downloadable title.

69747.name: The Third Hand
69747.description:
From the Studio 2 website:

The Rippers are caught up in a fast and furious adventure through London as they race against time to save a man's life.

This new Rippers adventure is written by Wiggy and features an equal measure of problem solving and combat. Can the heroes solve the puzzles, defeat their foes, and beat the clock to thwart the machinations of the Cabal's evil minions?

Find out in The Third Hand.

This 19 page pdf is bookmarked and also has a print friendly version to save on ink or toner.

69751.name: Scoreboard Baseball
69751.description:
Welcome to the world of Scoreboard Baseball !
Scoreboard Baseball is a full stat quick play baseball game that can be played in around 10-12 minutes from out of the box to stat completion. There are no lineups to decide upon and no score sheets to fill out yet the game unfolds inning by inning with a key player and action being revealed along the way. While it can be used to add on to existing full play baseball games, such as Inside Pitch Baseball, it can also hold its own as a season replay game.

Each team is represented by a single chart that shows all of the possible players and how they effect scoring in an inning when called upon to deliver as a key player. It could be the 3rd string catcher that comes through or maybe your backup shortstop. One roll per inning gets you all the action plus all the pitchers stats for that inning.

All hitters are rated for, basically, runs created. This is how runs can be scored during an inning. They also have ratings for HR, 3B, 2B, SB and hits in general. How often a hitter is called upon is based on how many plate appearances he had during the season being replayed. The bigger the hit type, a HR beats a single, the better chance to have that big inning. How many runs a team scored in an inning during the year is recreated with Scoreboard as each team has its own scoring chart.

Pitchers are rated on H, K and BBs. They also have ratings which can cause runs to score in an inning or block potential runs from scoring. The pitchers' stay in the game relies upon how many hits, runs and walks he gives up in his stint. Deciding who pitches doesn't slow the game down as pitchers have start and relief ranges that you can use to "coach" the team.

Relievers are not left out of the mix as all their appearances and stats can be tracked as well. When to bring in a certain reliever is also covered with 7 different scoring/inning breakdowns that are based upon actual year appearances. Your middle guys will come in at the proper times and be effective (non-effective) just like the year the charts recreate.

While most stats are gathered during the game some loose ends must be accounted for at games' end. These are handled with each player given ranges to fill in those RBI and hit stats so that the score sheet comes out even.

You don't just roll for a final score in Scoreboard but you get the ebb and flow of the game broken down per inning. Sometimes your less than stellar players will need to come through in a pinch recreating the excitement of a play-by-play game just done quicker. By the end of the game, you will have these stats for the players as well as see when and how they happened in the game.

Pitchers: W, L, SV, IP, H, R, ER, K, BB

Hitters: H, 2B, 3B, HR, SB, RBI

After a series or two from a team, multipliers are given to each player to show how many AB he would have based on the number of games his team has played. This can be used to get you batting average leaders, etc... for your league.

Get on the Board with Scoreboard Baseball !

69752.description:
A Game for Two Players

The object of the game is to try to place four counters of the same colour in a row. Players take turns to throw the four dice (2 yellow, 2 white), and put a counter on a square on the board according to the dice score, with yellow dice counting on the horizontal axis, and white dice on the vertical axis.

The game art is tennis based, but there is no real tie in with tennis in the game itself.

This is a precis of the rules from the rule book.

boardgameversion.31013: Swedish Marketing and Trading First Edition

69752.name: Grand Slam

69753.name: The Book of Distinctions and Drawbacks
69753.description:
From the publisher:

A comprehensive and carefully-balanced system of character flaws and advantages for use with fantasy d20 games. The Book of Distinctions & Drawbacks offers character flaws and advantages, running the gamut from simple personal hindrances to complex background troubles, magical curses, genetic taints, and benefits such as lands, titles, and fortifications.

69754.name: The Book of Distinctions & Drawbacks Revised
69754.description:
From the publisher:

A comprehensive and carefully-balanced system of character flaws and advantages for use with fantasy d20 games, newly revised and expanded with 30 additional pages of material. The Book of Distinctions & Drawbacks Revised offers more than 175 character flaws and advantages, running the gamut from simple personal hindrances to complex background troubles, magical curses, genetic taints, and benefits such as lands, titles, and fortifications.

69755.name: The Foundation: A World in Black & White
69755.description:
Publisher Blurb:

A superhero role-playing game that uses the d20 system provides a setting, the rules for super-powered d20 and a novella detailing the origins of the setting. The setting is adapted from a series of short stories by the author, Eric Metcalf, about a team called the Guardians. Much of the book is devoted to the characteristic and background of the heroes and villains.

69757.description:
From the cover:

Vehicles and Equipment

Scenarios for: Tunis, Sicily, Kursk, Salerno and Tarawa

Inside:

This package contains 45 more vehicles plus additional weapons to use with Battalions In Crisis! Each theatre of operations in 1943 is represented with a historical scenario, The scenarios range in complexity from one player on a side to large scale engagements requiring three or four players on a side. We hope you find the information in this module interesting, useful and enjoyable.

User:

Contains some of the more useful vehicles such as the Pz IV H and PZ V D, Stug IIIg, T34/85, Sherman Firefly, M3 halftrack, M4A3E8 and even the LVT1A and LVT2. Handheld antitank launchers have been updated to distinguish Pzf30 and Pzf60 and differences in performance for all the other types. Germany has gained the Pak 43 88mm, UK the 17pdr and USA the 76mm. Basically the equipment you would expect from this period.

There is also a small notes on play and erratta section which corrects rules on movement and infantry anti-tank.

All fits neatly in the original three ring binder.
69757.name: Battalions In Crisis! Module I: 1943

69758.description:
User Summary.

This module rounds out the game to become a complete package for WW2 small unit simulation.

Adds on the last of the armour from 1944-45 including the IS2, M24 Chaffee, M26 Pershing, PzIVJ, Koenigstiger and Crab.

Addition to the basic rules include;
Spaced Armour immunity to HEAT based weapons,
High velocity guns no longer benefiting from falling shots at extreme ranges,
The additional carnage of multiple barrelled weapons and
The devestating power of rocket artillery.

The platoon roster have now been replaced with nation specific versions including early (rifles) and late (assault rifles and LMGS) versions for Germany.

The major update to the system is the inclusion of what the designers call a 'Box Wars' points sysem for competitive play. This adds a meticulous costing system to every item already included in the game. This is particularly useful for the more casual gamer who is not looking to recreate a specific action.

The five new scenarios are very well presented and now include a useful General Situation, Commanders' briefings and Umpire notes.
69758.name: Battalions In Crisis! ModuleII: 1944-45

69760.name: The Perils of Ophelia
69760.description:
Three Sages Games line of GSL 4E products for Dungeons and Dragons
3SG-5000 Heroic Encounters - module A1; The Perils of Ophelia
What does the fate of the cursed lizard-like Aran'than people, a festering family feud of noble blood, the once lost diary of a dead cleric, and forbidden love have in common?
Your band of Heroes of course!
A1; The Perils of Ophelia is the first in a line of authorized 4E D&D adventurers that take gaming modules to a new level. Written to mesh into almost any 4E campaign, this adventure offers the following innovations:
* Different encounter groups of monsters from the same faction provide the DM a range of choices
to cover 4th to 8th level and four to six characters. Regardless of the number of players or their
level, an appropriate challenge is provided that keeps the story flow intact. This also allows the
DM is easily adjust the difficulty based on the player's gaming experience and the character's
equipment.
* Result based flow chart leads players through encounters in a logical fashion based on what they
accomplish or choose to attempt. They can fail to win an encounter and still continue through the
story line to the end. Several possible end-adventure results are possible depending on the player's
actions.
* Reusability is built in. Several of the story encounters and all of the random encounters can easily
be used in a different adventure that is city oriented. The included Stone Bard Inn staff dossier
provides an inn that can be revisited by the players many times.
* Meshes with the Art of WorTM City Tile’s Stone Bard Inn set, reusing the inn tiles to represent
other locations in the city. Can also be played without the tiles.
* Role Play nodes complete with multiple text blocks for main NPCs regarding a range of situations
that are likely to come up. Somewhat like cut scenes in a computer game that move the story along
and set up the next encounter.

The Perils of Ophelia includes the following features -
* A special, Wet/Dry Erase Art of Wor City Tile (8x10.5 inch) for one of the encounters.
* More than 50 statistic blocks detailing game information for monsters and NPCs from numerous
factions included the Devil Dog mercenaries, devils, Aran'than "Lizoid" people, street gangs,
undead, voodoo devil cultists, an assassin group, city watch, and inn staff.
* Ten adventure encounters, six role play nodes, and ten random encounters detailed.
* The Stone Bard InnTM dossier with the base information required to flesh out the inn for both'
this adventure and future campaign use.
* A stand alone plot that is part of a larger story line of three adventurers designed to take players
through the threshold of Paragon tier where they will affect the fortunes of all the Aran'than for
better or worse.

Plot Overview (No spoilers of course...)
The heroes have stopped in at a favored inn within a major city for a little rest. However they find themselves offered the task of protecting the Viscount Laomedon and his niece Ophelia for a few days until the viscount's men arrive to resume that duty. He's in the city looking for a diary. If the heroes are game for it, they must protect the Viscount and his niece amid a nasty family feud for control of a county while procuring the diary and fighting off mercenaries, street gangs, and anyone else posing a danger or that is after the diary. All while avoiding arrest by the City Watch for causing strife in the city as well. Not to mention that they will be forced to deal with Ophelia's little "issue"......

69761.description:
Panzer General: Russian Assault is a sequel to the hit title Panzer General: Allied Assault and is a quick playing game of WWII tactical / operational combat using a unique blend of cards, miniatures, and a board game.

New to the Panzer General game system with this sequel are 80 plastic miniatures depicting tanks, infantry and artillery. There are also over 100 new Action Cards, Units, and Abilities.

The game provides 12 solo and two-player scenarios depicting combat situations between the German and Russian forces in such battles as Stalingrad, Kursk, Moscow, Leningrad and many others.

The game will support both solo and 2-Player gameplay.

Published by Petroglyph and under license from Ubisoft®.
69761.name: Panzer General: Russian Assault

69762.name: The Eastern Seaboard
69762.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Ever wonder what your city would be like as a Ward? Now you can find out!

This second supplement to the Asylum RPG details the six East Coast Wards, which are built on the ruins of former cities: Mt. Ward (Montreal), Massward (Boston), NYWard (New York), Discward (Washington, D. C.), Atward (Atlanta), and MyWard (Miami). Each Ward section details that location, complete with histories, a map, a description the major buildings and forces, a list of local rumors, and an adventure geared specifically towards that setting. Each Ward section is written by a native of that area for more accuracy. The insanity is coming to your city!

69763.name: Chosen
69763.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Long ago, mythic Beasts walked the Earth.
Now they roam the stars.
Will YOU be Chosen?

Clockworks' third game, Chosen, is a unique combination of mythology and stellar exploration, focusing on the notion of legendary creatures come to life again in a futuristic world. These creatures, the Beasts, embody humanity’s creativity. They appear whenever humanity faces a turning point, and strive to shift the balance towards individuality, creativity, and chaos. But the Beasts have no physical form, so they must seek out avatars. They examine the Gifted, those mortals with unusual abilities, and then select those who match them in temperament. Ultimately only one Gifted can be Chosen, and he or she becomes the Beast incarnate, bonding with that powerful entity. The year is 2500, and the Beasts have returned, preparing for the next turning point in human history. And you play the Gifted. But this time things have changed, and the Beasts find themselves facing lasers and starships and intelligent computers - devices far more powerful than they remember. How will these creatures react, and how will humanity react to the return of their ancient legends?

The rulebook contains everything you need to play except for a handful of dice, a pencil, and some paper. So pull up a chair, gather round with your friends, and enter a world where myths are real, and so are the monsters -- but which are which?

69764.description:

69776.description:
The game is played on four trays, each tray having four by four holes where marbles can be placed. The trays are placed side by side on the board and each player starts the game with 12 marbles. On each players turn he can place one of his marbles on any tray as he chooses and thus trying to make four in a row (or a Q4 as it's called in the game rules). The Q4 can be on a single tray or spanning all the trays (that is, three dimensional).

After a player has played all his marbles he can start to move them around (on the same tray or between trays). After placing a marble he can claim a Q4. If the Q4 is on a single tray it should be fairly obvious whether it's a Q4 or not. If the Q4 spans all the trays, they must be stacked (the leftmost being on the bottom, the rightmost on the top) and then it can be checked whether the claim for a Q4 is true or not.

The first one to make a Q4 wins the game.

Similar to:

3D Tic Tac Toe - which is played on 3x3x3 grid
Four Letter Words - though with words
Qubic - which is also played, with placement only, on 4x4x4 grid but with 32 markers for each player
Tetrano - which is the same game represented on a 4x4 board.
Qubic - which has a version for 3 players also
Score Four - 4x4 grid of pegs that are filled from the bottom up
69776.name: Q4

69777.description:
A two-player Advanced Squad Leader scenario designed by Eric Bongiovanni. Players can choose to represent elements of the German KG Bayer, 116th Panzer Division, or American elements of 23rd Engineers Regiment,

This hex-and-counter wargame scenario recreates the actions of German and American troops in Hotton, Belgium, 21 December 1944 as the Germans attempt to take the Hotton Bridge and the Americans defend it as part of the Battle of the Bulge.

Victory Conditions:
The Germans win at game end if they have more Victory Points than the Americans. Victory Points are accorded as follows: 1 Victory Point for each good order squad (only) equivalent / mobile Armored Fighting Vehicle on the north bank at
69777.name: Probing For The Hotton Bridge

69778.description:
An Advanced Squad Leader Scenario designed by Eric & Michel Bongiovanni. This expansion of the Advanced Squad Leader Rule Book recreates a battle of The Continuation War between Finnish and Russian elements on the Karelia Isthmus, 16th April 1942.

Finnish elements of the 12th Brigade have installed an observation post in a hunting lodge on a hill. From there, they direct harassing fire on Russian positions. Soldiers of the Russian 46th Infantry Division supported by T-50 tanks of the 306rd tank Brigade receive orders to take the hill.

Victory Conditions:
The Russians win at game end ifthey have more Good Order Squad equivalent than the Finns in hexes 50X5/X6/Y6/Y7.

Requires:

Advanced Squad Leader Rule Book (Multi Man Publishing)

Board 5 and Russian Order of Battle from Beyond Valor ASL Module 1 (Multi Man Publishing)

Board 50 and Axis Minor Order of Battle from Armies of Oblivion ASL Module 12 (Multi Man Publishing)
69778.name: The Shooting Lodge

169583.name: Polis: Fight for the Hegemony – Promotional Events

boardgamehonor.24510: 2013 Golden Geek Best 2-Player Board Game Nominee

69779.description:
Polis: Fight for the Hegemony is a two-player civ-lite game set in the beginning of the conflict between the two major poleis of the 5th century B.C: Athens and the Delian League against Sparta and the Peloponnesian League. The winner will be the Empire with more population and prestige at the end of the game.

With a growing empire, feeding your people is the main goal. Wheat was scarce in Greece, so both players must secure other goods supply and the route to five markets in order to trade them for wheat. Each territory may give you different amount of wood, metal, wine, olive oil, silver and some wheat; these two last ones are hard to get but precious. It’s up to you if you want to get more of only one good or less from several of them. Every turn you get goods from a territory you must have some population there (supporting your Empire) but in the end they also have to be fed.

Fighting for the control of the territories and the sieges of the polis will be the job of your hoplites, your triremes will struggle to secure the routes to Egypt, Persia...so you can trade with them when the price is low, and a good use of your Diplomatic may convince a Polis to join your League easily.

A Polis may be your ally, but they are very proud of their independence, so you will have to create some Projects (statues, temples, artists, philosophers, games...) in order to gain Prestige which is needed for all your military manoeuvres.
69779.name: Polis: Fight for the Hegemony

69780.description:
100 Points Hold'em is a simple, casual card game in the 100 Points line of games that uses 100 Points cards.

Like Texas Hold'em? Want to try something different and maybe a little simpler? Then try 100 Points Hold'em!

In 100 Points Hold'em players are dealt 2 cards face-down. The Dealer then plays 2 cards (one at a time) face-up while players bet token to stay in the game. Using the 2 cards dealt to them face down and the 2 shared cards dealt face-up on the table, players see who has the best hand. The player closest to 100 points in their hand without going over wins the round. The game ends when only one player has 3 tokens or more.

For 2 to 5 players. Simple. Casual. Fun. 100 Points Hold'em

(Publisher description)
69780.name: 100 Points Hold'em

69781.description:
100 Points Prediction is a simple, casual card game in the 100 Points line of games that uses 100 Points cards.

In 100 Points Prediction each player rolls a 6-sided die and draws a number of cards equal to their roll. Each player then guesses as to what the total number of points are of all the cards in all the players' hands. One by one players reveal their cards and everyone finds out the the total number of points. The player who guessed the closest without going over wins. The losing players put their cards in their discard pile. The last player with cards in their deck wins.

The game can be played with 2 or more players.

Each player needs their own set of 100 Points cards and a 6-sided die to play the game.
(Publisher description)
69781.name: 100 Points Prediction

69783.name: Operation: Perfect Blue
69783.description:
From the back of the book

Operation: Perfect Blue is a last ditch effort by the remaining people of your planet to take back what is rightfully theirs. As BLUE Level operatives, the fate of the planet is in your hands!


Design, build and maintain your base of operations
Research and develop new technologies to use in the game
Start a manufacturing facility to make your own unique weapons and equipment
Play the role of Perfect Blue soldiers and go on covert missions to destroy Triaxy targets
Assume the role pf your Executive Characters to handle diplomatic issues and seek out new sources of funding
Pilot starships, massive walkers and other military vehicles
A complete RPG, containing combat rules, skills and a plethora of races and soldier tiypes to choose from

69784.name: Haunted House
69784.description:
From the publisher:

The mice play in the empty room, and the bats flit through the broken windows. The stairs squeak... even when no one is on them. And something is watching...

100804.name: Good Help: Evil Doctors and an Angry Mob

69785.description:
You have just finished your evil doctorate. Now it's time for you to return to a castle on the outskirts of the town where you grew up, to begin your tyranny in the name of revenge. Every bully that gave you a wedgie in school and every cutie who laughed at your advances will feel the wrath of the monster you are about to create...

Your goal in Good Help is to create the best monster that you can, then unleash it on the public – but don't take too long as the first player to have his monster destroy five buildings in town wins. Alternatively, you can set your monster on those of the other players, and if you have the last monster standing, you win.

To assist you in your goal – and to preserve your reputation in town – you'll hire assistants, then send them out to collect body parts, buy supplies and earn money. Your assistants can confront those of other doctors to try to steal away the gold, supplies or limbs they carry. Each assistant has at least one vice, however, and when moving about town they might be lured away by the prospect of beer, jewelry, dresses or sausage, selling or dropping everything they have to get their fix. Good help is indeed hard to find!
69785.name: Good Help

69786.name: Portal
69786.description:
Portal is a two-player abstract game played on a hex board where player's attempt to capture each others pieces. Each player has four different sized units that can move different amounts of spaces on a turn (1-4). Pieces are allowed free movement but may not move through a space they have already occupied that turn or move through another piece. Pieces can only capture in a straight line of hexes equal to their movement amount and may jump other pieces when capturing.

A key aspect to Portal is the turn structure. On alternating turns players will make one and two movements. That is, on turn 1, P1 will move once and P2 twice. On turn 2, P1 moves twice and P2 moves once and so on.

A portal board consists of three seperate types of "special" hexes.

The middle hex is the Portal. If you begin your turn with a piece in the portal you may move it to any open open, non-special space on the board and then make your movement(s) for that turn.

The spaces surrounding the portal are weakened. A piece in those spaces may not make a capturing move, except a "1" may capture into the portal only.

The red corner spaces are protected. A piece in that space cannot be captured, however, it must be moved out of that space on the player's next turn or it is removed from the board.

The game ends when one player has one or fewer pieces remaining on the board. Each remaining piece scores points equal to its movement value. The player with the higher score wins.

Portal is currently entered in the nestorgames continuous abstract contest as well as the 1,000 Year Design Challenge.

http://www.boardgamegeek.com/geeklist/48043/item/1260124#ite...

www.thousandyeargame.com

69787.name: Smoking Game
69787.description: A promotional game by International Team commissioned by some tobacco companies (Philip Morris, etc.) (the game was recommended for ages 12+ (!)). Every player is a different kind of smoker, moving along the game board the players must find out what type of smoker the other players are.

69788.name: My Son the Doctor
69788.description:
Want to make Mama proud? Become My Son the Doctor. Let Mama impress her friends. Become My Daughter the Movie Star. Maybe you'd rather have money and influence. Become My Son the Tycoon. How about...would you like to rule the world? Become My Son the Politician. All it takes is a little luck...a little concentration and knowing when to keep your mouth shut!

(From front page of the rules.)

Drawing on traditional Jewish humor, this game encourages players to aspire to their Mama's dreams of becoming somebody. Players begin at home with Mama and through the course of the game, pick up Odd Jobs and Tools of the Trade. Once the player gets to their target profession after acquiring 4 Good Tools for that Trade, they win!

Movement on the board is via dice, one specifically for each dimension, with the player choosing the direction. Landing on a free Odd Job gains the player both a random Odd Job card and a random Tool from a profession of their choice. If a player lands on someone else's Odd Job and they get to steal a Tool. Being lazy will cause a player to lose a turn, and sometimes it's best just to Go Home to Mama. However, if a player can catch a Lucky Break, then end up on a square of their choice, which is the best way to land a profession!

The mechanics are simple, but remembering who has what can be more difficult as cards are constantly being exchanged.

boardgamehonor.8752: 2010 Golden Geek Best Card Game Nominee

69789.description:
Ascension: Deckbuilding Game — originally released as Ascension: Chronicle of the Godslayer — is a fast-paced deck-building game designed by Magic: The Gathering Pro Tour champions Justin Gary, Rob Dougherty, and Brian Kibler, with artwork by Eric Sabee.

Ascension is a deck-building game in which players spend Runes to acquire more powerful cards for their deck. It offers a dynamic play experience where players have to react and adjust their strategy accordingly. Each player starts with a small deck of cards, and uses those cards to acquire more and better cards for their deck, with the goal of earning the most Honor Points by gaining cards and defeating monsters.
69789.name: Ascension: Deckbuilding Game

69791.name: The Plane Above: Secrets of the Astral Sea
69791.description:
Secrets of the Astral Sea

From the Publisher's Website:

Climb aboard an astral skiff and set sail for adventure!

On the Astral Sea, characters face off against angels, devils, githyanki, and even the gods and their exarchs while exploring dungeons, raiding astral galleons, and establishing themselves as demigods. This game supplement builds on the overview of the Astral Sea presented in the Manual of the Planes game supplement and explores the heavenly plane in greater detail. From the cavernous layers of Nine Hells to the dark dungeons of Tytherion, adventure awaits in every astral dominion and on the vast, uncharted sea that stretches between them.

This game supplement describes the Astral Sea and key locations throughout the plane. It also presents a multitude of new monsters, as well as adventure hooks, encounters, hazards, and everything Dungeon Masters need to make the Astral Sea a featured setting in their campaigns.

69792.name: Secrets of the Ancients
69792.description:
From the back of the book:

You have heard the rumors. Untold millennia ago, they ruled the land - their power and wisdom were legendary. Now their cities are gone, their might buried in forgotten ruins and hidden vaults. The Logheir built crystal towers that reached towards the skies, proclaiming their challenge to the gods themselves. The Tlacamoc served their Blood Gods, feeding them thousands of victims every year. The bards say their ancient kingdoms are no more. ...but now you wonder.

You hear new stories. Long-dead things stir in a half-buried pyramid. A mighty sword is discovered, attracting both treasure hunters and undead abominations. A chance encounter on a solitary road leads to the sick and decadent court of the last Logheir monarch. A friendly halfling village harbors soul-twisting horrors beneath its pleasant face. You vow to discover the secrets of the ancients, and survive to tell the tale...

Secrets of the Ancients presents a series of vignettes that can be used individually or together to enrich any fantasy campaign using the d20 game system.

69793.name: Tall Towers
69793.description:
In Tall Towers each player represents a carpenter during the Medieval Age who has been tasked with building a city tower for the Prince. Each player must build a tower taller and more efficiently than the other players. Everyone grabs one of the 6 foundation boards, each with a unique build queue that you are trying to complete during the frantic trading sessions.
After everyone has chosen a foundation board, the game can begin. There are 2 phases repeated throughout the game. The first phase is the Trading/Resource Gathering Phase. Everyone starts with the same deck of 40 Cards, but you will not be using your own cards to build your Tall Tower. Instead the trading/resource gathering is done through an interesting real-time blind trading mechanic. It is a quick thinking and chaotic trading session quite similar to games such as Pit, or Set. Everyone is trading simultaneously, so act fast to get the cards you need, and bluff your opponents into taking the bad cards from your hand.
The second phase is the Build Phase, where you use the cards you received in the previous phase to build your Tall Tower. Of course it is not as easy as it sounds. You must play the cards in the order you received them, you cannot rearrange your hand. Some cards are good and will help you finish up the next floor of your Tower, or they could be bad and send cracks through a few of the stones you gathered during the Resource Phase.
The Players go through 8 Rounds (of 5 cards each) alternating between these 2 phases, and the one with the Tallest Tower wins. There is lots of chaos during trading, lots of speculation between players as they try to talk each other into taking their cards, and lots of fun as you flip over your resources and see how good you did or how bad you crumbled.

69794.name: The Lost City
69794.description:
From the Back of the Book:

The Lost City is a fully developed location sourcebook for the d20 post-apocalyptic role-playing game, Darwin's World. Designed for starting characters, The Lost City details in full the legendary "Sunken City", formerly Bakersfield, California, as described briefly in the Darwin's World Gazetteer, at the foot of the Great Rift Vally.

A party of four to six characters of level 1-3 should be able to meet and deal with the initial dangers of the Lost City, but later dangers will require characters of much greater levels. The very nature of the city permits characters to carve out a niche or base of operations; permitting a protracted campaign to explore the city and encounter its bizarre troglodilian peoples.

69795.name: Song of Storms

rpghonor.14332: 2002 ENnie for Best Adventure - Runner Up

69795.description:
From the Publisher's Website:

Without warning, a mysterious and deadly storm rolls in from the horizon, mercilessly striking the peaceful fishing village of Thrund. Clearly unnatural in origin, the terrifying storm seems directed by some malignant will, and rumors spread like wildfire, speaking of an ancient curse resurrected, a curse whose origins lie more than five hundred years in the past. You have only a few days to unravel the tangled skein of rumor and legend in order to piece together the source of this unnatural storm, for as each night passes, the storm grows stronger and stronger, threatening to bring the village crashing into the sea. Can you discover the source of this storm, and find a way to stop it, this time forever? Song of Storms is the first adventure to take place in the wild, dangerous region known as the Stormlands. Song of Storms takes the heroes into the heart of the Stormlands, a land where the Old Ways clash with the new, where the gods still walk the land and involve themselves with the affairs of mortals, and where the land itself can be the greatest enemy of all.

69796.description:
From the back of the box: The DVD Version of the Price is Right enables players to "Come on Down" and be a part of all the action and excitement of a real TV show contestant. Try your hand at Plinko, or Cliffhangers, and live the thrill of spinning the big wheel in the Showcase Showdown.

This game is very similar to The Price Is Right but instead of requiring a player to play the host, the DVD contains the emceeing of Todd Newton and announcer work by various Price announcers, most prominently then-current announcer Rich Fields. It also supports a larger number of players.
69796.name: The Price Is Right Game: DVD Edition

69797.name: After Winter Dark Campaign Setting
69797.description:
From the back of the book:

For a thousand years the world of Erde was bound to the service of the horned god, Unklar. Ruling from the towers of Aufstrag he blanketed all in Winter's Dark. His reign ended in a wash of rebellion and war. New powers rose in his stead. Men carved new kingdoms from his dying empire, dwarves rose from the ashes of history, and the elves returned from the lands of Fay with a vengeance! The world was born anew!

69798.name: The Complete Monstrous Wizard's Compendium
69798.description:
From the back of the book:

The Complete Monstrous Wizard's Compendium is a d20 system sourcebook designed for players and game masters who want to take their "typical" fantasy campaigns to the next level. This book gives you the information you need to create and play characters from six different monstrous races, but more importantly, it also gives you the tools you need to create powerful spellcasters - of any race.

69800.name: Rapture: The Second Coming (d20 edition)
69800.description:
From the back of the book:

Rapture: The Second Coming is a new d20 system edition of this classic game about the end times. Characters fight to aid the celestial armies and save humanity - or join the infernal horde, paving the way for Lucifer's conquest.


Requires the use of a roleplaying game core book (d20 Modern)

69801.name: Cars Bingo
69801.description:
(from back of box)
"Get SUPERCHARGED with Lightning McQueen and his pals as they prepare to compete with cars from around the world in the Radiator Springs Supercharged International Grand Prix! The neon's sizzling, the asphalt's hot, and Lightning's pals are sporting slick new paint jobs as they gear up for the big race. Put your pedal to the metal and steer right to the hottest spot in racing - Radiator Springs. Play this supercharged spinner Bingo with Lightning McQueen and his pals, all your favorite Cars characters!"

This is a children's bingo game with a Cars theme. Each player receives a bingo card with a 5x5 grid of Cars characters (Ramone, Doc Hudson, Guido, Lightning McQueen, Mater, Sally, Luigi) with different colored backdrops (Red, Green, Yellow, Blue, Purple). A spinner is used to call spaces. For example: If the spinner arrow points to the color blue and Mater's face, "Blue Mater" is called out. Any player with a Blue Mater picture on their card would cover it with a chip. The first player to cover 5 characters in a row with chips wins.

69802.name: Starbattles (The Card Game)
69802.description:
User Summary...

Created as a follow-up to the Starbattles tactical space combat game, Starbattles (The Card Game) is described in its rulebook as "a beginner level card game of tactical space combat. It is a fast paced card game where all the action is in front of you and in your hand."

To date, only simply produced play-test versions of this game have been documented. It is unknown whether or not this game ever made it into full production.

Components:
- 1 Rules Folder (6 pages on continuous paper)
- 54 Ship Cards (all cards for this game are printed on sheets for players to cut out)
- 1 Set of Hit/Destroyed Counters (the sheet devoted to last minute changes indicates that these are not included)
- 6 Play Sheets
- 6 Player Order Cards
- 114 Action Cards
- (a six-sided die is required, but not included)

Notes on play:
Each player has a Play Sheet where ship status and damaged is tracked. Essentially, the Play Sheet represents a player's home base... their ships (as represented on Ship Cards) are placed on areas on the Play Sheet that show the ship's position relative to their base. Players score victory points by finishing off other player's ships. The game ends and victory points are totaled when only one player has active ships left.

69803.name: Petaouchnok
69803.description:
A light illustrated cardgame, where the first player with only three cards in his hands (1 place, 1 dress and 1 vehicle) is the winner. Every player starts with 10 cards and on their turn play cards that matches the previous card. Special cards (ban, +3, miss your turn etc.) make it harder for your opponents.

Text on back of the box:
"By taking the cable car, reach the moon dressed in armour. It's possible! But avoid the pitfalls! You have to be sharp to arrive first."

69804.name: The Classic Dungeons & Dragons Game
69804.description:
From the back of the box:

...the dragon lunges. Your flashing blade slices the air as searing flames burst over your shield. A lightning bolt crackles from the wizard's fingertips, then bounces harmlessly off the ancient beast's scarred and scaly hide. Will you stay and battle this deadly monster, or leave it behind with its hoard of stolen treasure.

The DUNGEON & DRAGONS Game lets you and your friends create and play mighty warriors, shrewd wizards, cunning elves, and nimble thieves.

Easier than ever to learn!
- A 128 page Rules and Adventure Book takes you adventuring while you learn the game!
- 6 molded plastic character figures
- 24 standup counters featuring the awesome monsters you face.
- A 6 panel DUNGEON MASTER Screen puts important rules at your fingertips.
- A large, full-color Dungeon Poster Map and a complete set of Adventure Dice.

Epic Adventures with Wizards, Dragons, and Magic await... Do you feel brave?


User summary:

Fifth and final edition of the classic D&D Basic role-playing system.

69805.name: Untold Battle
69805.description:
(from the Web Site)Untold Battle™ is a fast-paced, exciting way for players to duke it out with custom built creatures and parties. Showcasing the many Battle Factions of the Untold universe, Untold Battle was created for two players to choose two opposing factions and fight with tooth, bullet, tentacle and spell until only one side remains. But Battle players are not limited - they can use all of the Untold cards to change and make their units unique, or even create their own character, just as if they were going to play the roleplaying game. And Battle doesn't need to be two sided, the rules work for one-on-one, one-on-many, or many-on-many. Untold Battle Rules provide a brutal, bloody, and hard-hitting game that packs a punch!
The Battle Factions

Untold offers limitless possibilities for worlds and adventures. And on every world there are nations, corporations, shadow organizations, alien marauders, and so forth; we collectively call these Factions. We've built all the unique creatures, minions, soldiers, and things that go bump in the night and put them together in Battle Faction packs, so you can pick your favorites or mix and match to do Battle. Untold Battle offers an arena for all the forces of your imagination to duke it out. Now you can pit zombies against soldiers, or tentacled demons against steam punk robots. Or you can help shape the destiny of one of the Untold worlds: will the brave forces of the North American Union overcome the twisted Flux Horrors? Or you can help reshape the face of Europe as the Churl Confederation advances on the new knights of Novus Europa!
The Untold Rules

Untold Battle utilizes Untold Minion Cards because they are quick to use. Minions are one card, instead of a number of cards, that represent a single character, and that is important when your Battle has a large number of forces. And Minions still offer the limitless customization of Untold Powers through Swapping.

Once players choose their Factions and/or characters, Battle is as simple as lining up the cards on the table across from each other and taking turns between their minions. Battle utilizes Untold's simple and quick combat mechanics (see our Online Primer for more, or just refer to back of the handy insert that comes with every Battle Faction pack), and all the rules you need for the minions are on the cards!

69806.name: The Innocent
69806.description:
Publisher's Blurb

A child’s laughter when she wins a game with her parents honestly for the first time, the joy of tearing into brightly wrapped packages at Christmas, a moment of helpless laughter, without care or reservation. The Innocent is empowered by all these things; an Innocent gains their power from joy itself.

Innocents are instinctive mages; their power doesn’t come from study and rote memorization of arcane formula; instead it comes in a rush of inspiration as they play, as they teach children, and as they craft amazing toys that are almost alive. Some Innocents claim they learned their secrets from some long forgotten fey race, from changelings and elves hidden just behind mortal eyes; others believe themselves to be half kitsune. All Innocents share a heritage; they are all the children or students of supernatural tricksters and mischievous craftsmen. The Innocent injects anime-inspired levity, innocence and a childlike sense of fun into your D20 Modern Campaign.

Included in this PDF are the rules needed to use The Innocent in your game, including a host of new abilities and 55 new Meta-Magic feats.

69807.description:
Expat-Abenteuer is designed to prepare players, particularly families with children, for moving abroad. There are several expansions for specific countries.

The players roll and move along a track. The goal is to earn "expat points". The points are awarded by cards, other cards send the players forward or back. The cards can be kept for future use, but when certain points on the track are reached, the players have to discard them and receive negative points for them.
Whenever a player draws a card, another player can also force one of his/her cards on him/her, making the "trip" less predictable.
The first player to reach the end of the track gets some bonus points. The player with most points is the winner.

(User summary by HilkMAN)
69807.name: Expat-Abenteuer

69808.name: Expat-Abenteuer: Ergänzungsset Japan
69808.description: Japan expansion for Expat-Abenteuer. The expansions contains 55 cards with specific texts for families or other people who want to move to Japan.

69809.name: Expat-Abenteuer: Ergänzungsset China
69809.description: China expansion for Expat-Abenteuer. The expansions contains 55 cards with specific texts for families or other people who want to move to China.

69810.name: Expat-Abenteuer: Ergänzungsset Korea
69810.description: Korea expansion for Expat-Abenteuer. The expansions contains 55 cards with specific texts for families or other people who want to move to Korea.

69811.name: Expat-Abenteuer: Ergänzungsset Tschechien
69811.description: Czech Republic expansion for Expat-Abenteuer. The expansions contains 55 cards with specific texts for families or other people who want to move to the Czech Republic.

69812.name: Expat-Abenteuer: Ergänzungsset Indien
69812.description: India expansion for Expat-Abenteuer. The expansions contains 55 cards with specific texts for families or other people who want to move to India.

69813.name: Expat-Abenteuer: Ergänzungsset USA
69813.description: USA expansion for Expat-Abenteuer. The expansions contains 55 cards with specific texts for families or other people who want to move to the USA.

69814.description:
From the Publishers Website:

In four weeks time the largest airborne operation in history will begin once more. An entire airborne army will attempt to seize key bridges leading into the heartland of the Reich. Thirty British Corps will follow on from this attack, driving up the road to Arnhem and into the heartland of German. Can you end the war before Christmas or will it be a bridge too far?

Firestorm Market Garden is a campaign system for Flames of War.
69814.name: Flames of War Firestorm Campaign: Operation Market Garden

11168.name: Flames of War: The World War II Miniatures Game

69815.description:
An Axis & Allies like strategy game reliving the dramatic events of operation Market-Garden in September 1944. A large narrow mapboard represents the area from Eindhoven by Nijmegen to Arnhem. Units are plastic pieces representing infantry, tanks and artillery; 13 important plastic bridges are included. Almost every bridge is a stepping-stone to success. And every bridge can be blown.

The purpose of the game is to reach Arnhem and make contact with the British paras. The time frame is restricted and if the Allied player doesn't reach Arnhem on time, the paras are doomed and an easy target for the German elite forces!

The RULES are short and simple: the game focusses on strategy, and nothing else.

The game map has all the necessary information needed to play the game. Once you've read the rules once, there's no need to look up things anymore. (almost) Every bit of information is on the map.
No looking up hit probabilities, defense factors, or attack factors in rows and columns. No measuring with rulers. Just roll the dice.

Combat is resolved with the use of ten-sided color coded dice: so there's some luck involved, but a reasonable level.

Good tactics require the use of an optimal mix of units to get the job done.
Each kind of unit has its specific strength and weakness, depending on the battleground. Players should choose wisely which units to use where and when.
In this game the players don't get to choose the casualties themselves: a roll with the dice reveals the distribution of the hits. The FOG OF WAR is simulated by distributing the hits at random. In this way you are never totally in control: you plan your strategies, you work out plans, you anticipate as much as you can, but the outcome is never, ever perfect. With "Arnhem'44" both players get a much more 'realistic' game experience playing this game.
69815.name: Arnhem '44

69816.name: Round-A-Corner
69816.description: A simple spin-and-move game in which the object is to advance both of one's tokens from "Start" to "Home". One twist is that the spinner's numbers are divided into "Up", "Down", and "Round-A-Corner" zones. The players must spin within the appropriate zone to advance one of their pieces.

69817.name: Great Goblin!
69817.description:
From the front cover:

A group of adventurers vanish without a trace... only to reappear captive in a keep long thought abandoned and cursed! But far from empty, the keep is overrun with goblins! Are the goblins responsible for the abduction, or is the frightened young wizard in the keep somehow connected? And what of this other mysterious humanoid tribe hiding in the depths below? Will the adventurers solve these mysteries, or will they end the day as an entrée?

69818.description:
Exapnsion for Dead of Night.

This pnp expansion uses a second board, same size as the first one, and a specific deck of items. The new board and the old one may be assembled together for huge scenarios (have one team start in the mall, while the other is already trapped in the house with short ammo supplies and try to rescue them, etc).

The main idea is to avoid introducing any new rule, while providing new items, new rooms, and a different game experience thanks to the way the item distribution works.

The expansion is free, and includes :

New board
New items
New rooms
69818.name: Mall of the Dead

69819.description:
[Following Anzio-Cassino], the next game in the Battle Command Series will be Market Garden / Crete portraying two fascinating airborne operations. The game is playable in 1 to 2 hours maximum. http://www.boardgamegeek.com/boardgamefamily/5070/battle-com... )

The Battle Command Series are quick playing games with large 7/8" counters, a double sided map board, rules, and dice. Each battle has 4 pages of rules. Units are rated for their strength and movement, as well an endurance rating that reflect how much damage a unit can sustain in combat. Each battle includes 2 scenarios, one for the complete campaign, and one for a shorter scenario.
69819.name: Mercury/Market Garden

69821.description:
Dragons: Wettflug zur Dracheninsel ("Dragons: Race to Dragon i=Isle") is a game based on Dreamworks' How to Train Your Dragon 2. In the game, the dragon riders attempt to reach the Dragon Isle, while the dragon Screaming Death tries to prevent them from doing so.

At the beginning of each game, the board is created by lining up island tiles, starting with Viking Island (start) and ending with Dragon Isle (finish). The islands between start and finish come in four different colors.

The game is played in rounds. Each round, one player plays Screaming Death, while the others play a dragon rider. Each dragon rider has a hand with colored island cards. Each turn, each dragon rider selects one of these cards. At the same time, Screaming Death selects one color of islands to attack. Then, everybody reveals their cards. Each dragon rider that has selected the color that is being attacked by Screaming Death cannot move; the others move to the next island of their chosen color.

The round ends when two dragon riders have reached Dragon Isle, or when the dragon riders can no longer move because the deck of island cards has run out. The first dragon rider to reach Dragon Isle gains two coins; the second rider gains one coin. If no dragon rider reaches Dragon Isle, Screaming Death gains three coins. If only one rider reaches Dragon Isle, Screaming Death gains one coin.

The game continues with a new round, until each player has played Screaming Death once. Then, the player who has collected the most coins wins.

Spooky, an earlier version of this game, had the players as ghosts moving through a castle, with each player taking a turn as Merlin to try to stop the ghosts.
69821.name: Dragons: Wettflug zur Dracheninsel

69823.name: The Demise of Dr. Frankenstein
69823.description: In the Demise of Dr. Frankenstein you roll a number of dice, 6 for 2 players, 8 for 3 or 4 players, then those dice are placed on different action options based on the numbers rolled. The number one lets a player influence Igor, number two lets a player take body parts from the graveyard and so on. That allows players to influence different village members and accomplish different tasks on their way to building a Frankenstein Monster. After players use the clinician to study, the trader to get goods, bribe officers to look the other way as they construct different contraptions, and visit the curator, the villagers reach their anger boiling point and put an end to it all by buring down the doctors' efforts. Victory points are scored and then it's on to the next round until all players have had a chance to go first one time.

69825.name: Laskutaituri
69825.description:
Fast-paced calculation game for 1 to 8 players. On their turn, player throws 14 special 6-sided dice with numbers ranging from 1 to 15. Then player tries to place them in a grid of four rows, so that all rows show correct calculations. Correct calculations score points. Time for placement is limited with a hourglass.

The grid looks like this: (X = places for dice).
X + X = X
X - X = X
X * X = X +- X
X / X = X +- X

69826.description:
Enter the world of Wonderland and help Alice reach the Frabjous Day! You must navigate through Wonderland in order to encounter the Mad Hatter, the Cheshire Cat, the White Rabbit and the Red Queen, but watch out! This path moves!

Featuring four separate boards that make up one larger game board, Alice in Wonderland is a shifting, madcap world. Who will be the first to reach the Frabjous Day?

Players take turns moving through different sections of Wonderland (The Rabbit Hole, the Forest, the Tea Party and the Red Queen's Castle) collecting Drink Me cards. The Drink Me cards are used in each section to collect a favor from each of the characters that reside in that section of Wonderland (the White Rabbit, the Cheshire Cat, the Mad Hatter and the Red Queen, respectively).

Once a player has collected favors from all four characters, they may move to the Frabjous Day. The first player to reach the Frabjous Day wins!
69826.name: Tim Burton's Alice in Wonderland

69827.description:
Enter Into the world of the Twilight Saga

It all begins with a choice. Which path will you choose? Make your choice, then collect Friends, movie scene cards, and face the Newborn army! The more you know about the Twilight Saga: Eclipse and your friends the better your chance of winning.

Players take turns moving around in the world of the Twilight Saga. Each space on the board is part of a scene, and each space offers a challenge, either a trivia question about "Eclipse" or a strategy question (which can be a dice challenge, a voting challenge or a visualization/memory challenge). Successfully completing a challenge allows the player to collect that scene. The first player to collect all eight scenes wins!

Along their way to collecting all eight scenes, players will have to collect either Quileute or Cullen friends to help them defeat Newborn vampires. Players can also collect special Story cards to help them defeat challenges, or use Fast Movement spaces to move quickly from scene to scene.
69827.name: The Twilight Saga: Eclipse – The Movie Board Game

69828.name: Lines & Sunkers
69828.description:
Fun-to-play board game of Atlantic Canada. (from the box front)

Description from the back of the box:

"Lines & Sunkers (tm) offers Down-East humour at its best. The game is all about Atlantic Canada - its people, history, and culture.

"There are many ways to play - you can even develop your own!

"Start at Stagehead and follow the wave-like motion of the Gameboard. Roll with the uncertainty of the die to a Lighthouse or Sunker. Experience the Luck o' the Irish. Meet your friends for an English Cup o' Tea. Attend the Acadian "Joie de Vivre" Festival, or the world-famous Gathering of the Clans.

"Will you be hooked by our questions, or will you simply be in a FOG? Answer incorrectly, and see what the Stun'd Box has in store for you. A Lucky Shot will take you to the challenges of the Holdin' Ground. Then Jig-a-Double to reach home Safe & Sound.

"You don't have to be a trivia buff to win - you just have to be good at collecting and holding on to your O-fishial Stamps.

"Lines & Sunkers (tm) - a true reflection of Atlantic Canada!"

69830.name: Night of the Necromancer
69830.description:
Publisher blurb

Death is not the end...You are a knightly warrior, returning to your ancestral castle having been away for a number of years fighting a crusade against the forces of darkness in the Mauristatian principality of Bathoria. You are just within sight of home when you are struck down by a band of murderers. Driven by the need to know why you have been killed, and on whose orders, you rise again as a ghost. This is where your adventure begins, as you set out to solve the mystery of your own murder. All that follows occurs during the course of one night.


8 in Series 2

69831.name: Sold!
69831.description:
A new town has recently been developed near your neighborhood, full of office towers, shopping malls and housing estates. Can you outbid the other tycoons and be the one to cash in on this prospering town?

Sold! is an extremely mean auction game where players vie for control over the new properties in town. Over a series of 25 rounds, players bid for coloured cubes which are used to exert influences over the sales of individual properties. Will you channel your financial might on the office towers? Or will you bet on monopolizing the retail scene? Only the most cunning and opportunistic businessman will stand a chance to win!

Be wary though, there plenty of opportunities for your competitors to foil your most well laid plans!

69832.description:
In Mentis, your goal is to capture the opponent's king. Each player's king is fragile, unable to move from his hill on the side of the 7x7 board, but he defends that hill by sending out forces of Spears, Trenchmen and Nobles to fight across the board. Each turn, you either deploy, move or capture:


Deploy — Place 1-3 pieces in a stack orthogonally adjacent to your king's hill in a square not adjacent to an opponent's piece. You can place on an empty square or one holding your pieces, but you can't create a stack more than three pieces high.
Move — Move pieces orthogonally 1-3 spaces depending on the type of piece on top of the stack. You can drop off and pick up pieces as you move as long as you obey the three piece limit.
Capture — Use the top piece of your stack to capture an opponent's piece, but only if that piece is exactly the right distance (1-3 spaces) from the capturing piece and isn't of a type immune to attack from the capturing piece.
69832.name: Mentis

69833.name: Blazing Skies
69833.description:
Flying Officer Stumpy Prangsworthy’s handlebar moustache streamed behind him in the 280mph wind as he craned his head round trying to locate where Von Strudels Focke Wulf 190 A8 had gone to.
